text: 750 ml bottle shared, thanks nimbleprop! Slightly hazy golden amber with beige head. Aromas of funk, herbs, citrus. Tastes of funk, citrus, light buttery notes, oak. Light body with a dry finish.

750ml bottle, gushed HARD, then a hazy dark orange with some creamy white head. Nose is herbal, buttery, celery, artichoke. Flavor is sweet with honey, tart, celery, white pepper, vegetal, buttery. Dry finish, spritzy on the palate.
Wood and some oak. Pours orange with good head. Quite a lot of booze. Some boozy sweetness. Bottle.

From a bottle shared at the DC RB gathering Memorial Day weekend 2017 it is a hazy effervescent golden color with some floaters and a thick off white head. The aroma pineapple with a hint of cinnamon. The taste is on the sweet side with hints of red wine and oak. It is Smooth and delicious.

From a bottle shared at the DC RB gathering Memorial Day weekend 2017. Pours a hazy gold with some floaters and a thick off white head. Funky aroma with a hint of cinnamon. Flavors of red wine and oak. Smooth and delicious.
750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, some pale malts, light oak, light floral hops. Flavor the same, pretty boring. Average texture. Bland.

Bottle. Poured hazy amber color with an average fizzy off-white head that was fully lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted sweet malt, funk, wood and spice aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy complex sweet flavor with a medium to heavy smooth sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Better version of this beer.

Sample during the "Hoppin On Deck" tasting on 05/27/2016. The beer pours a cloudy orange-bronze color with a medium thick foamy white head that recedes gradually to a film. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of oak, floral yeast and fruit. Medium body with flavors of vinous oak, herbal yeast, citrus and malt. The finish is mildly funky with a fruity aftertaste. Above average overall.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Hazy light orange with medium white head. Aroma is citrus, medium body, medium carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is citrus, yeast, and dry finish. Remebicient of a Saison.

Draft locally (also from a bottle). Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have the character from the base beer, sweet malts, mild toast, grass, coriander and additional mild spice, some of the lemon peel comes through especially on the nose, mild funk, with some barrel influences, wood, cab barrel, with mild Brett funk, curious to see how this develops with time, interesting.

750 ml bottle via trade with JStax - thanks again, Jeremy! Shared at the Hyatt Monday night lobby fart share. Pours a cloudy orange-hued gold with a big frothy off-white head that settles unevenly. Notes of florals, farmhouse funk, wood, spice, cobwebs, apple, and pale and sweet malts. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a dry, funky mouthfeel. Nice stuff. Will develop in interesting ways, perhaps.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange gold with small frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is floral, honey, grape, brett. Medium mouth, honey malt, brett, grape, light dryness, very good.

Bottle shared during RBWG 2016. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy white head. The nose has some grainy bread, light caramel, orange. Medium sweet flavor with bready sugars, grains, citrus, wheat, faint grass, melon. Light bodied, airy, with lively carbonation. Sweet finish, still more ripening citrus, melon, tangerine, doughy bread. Not bad.
Bottle - Funky yeast and sweet perfume. Clearish gold with a rich bubbly head. Light yeasty effervescent and sweet grains. Nice.
Bottle at RBWG 2016. Thanks Peter. Nose is moderately sweet with a hint of lemon. Hazy deep orange. Taste is a citrus dominant honey sweetness with lots of zest. Pleasant.

Bottle shared at hotel lobby fart share @ RBWG 2016. Thanks peeterisattweeter! Light hazy amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of lemon, light grain, apple skin, light perfume, lime and wood. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium sour with notes of lemons, lime, wood and light raw sugar. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

750 ml bottle, label says Batch B002, bottled on 9/19/2015. Served in a Prairie Teku, the beer pours a hazy orange/amber color with a couple inch off-white head. Head retention and lacing are both good. I like the aroma, the brew smells like coriander, oak, white grapes/wine, and earthiness. I think the taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but with the addition of some caramel and mustiness. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its a bit slick with a good amount of carbonation. But its a soft carbonation so its smooth and goes down pretty easy. I think its drinking good now, but I might have to pick up another bottle if I can find one and see how it ages. Certainly worth trying if youve never had it before. This is the 2nd barrel aged Little Fish brew Ive had, and Ive liked them both so far. $13.99 a bottle.

On tap at Little Fish for their first bottle sale on 10/24/15. Clear amber pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light spice and funk. Malty and spicy flavor with caramel and yeast esters before a funky finish. Not getting a ton out of the brett and lacto yet. Interested to see what happens in the bottle over 1-2 years.

Draft sample at the source. The beer is a darker orange color with a white head of foam. In the aroma I get notes of spices, funk, some musty qualities, and a little bit of floral character. The taste has mild spice and a bit of funk, though the funk is not sour, more of a musty funk. Medium body and medium carbonation. Very tasty. Looking forward to seeing what this beer is like in the future.

5oz on tap at the brewery. Kind of a spicy peppery aroma up front, some toffee-caramel malt, mild bit of farmhouse funk. Bit woodsy and earthy. Hazy orange color. Ring of white head. Nice bit of mildly rindy orange citrus. Lighter tartness, mild to moderate bitter, moderate sweet. Mild slick in the body, mild dry in the finish. Sweet mildly caramely malt is a bit noticeable in the flavor. The bacteria doesnt seem to have done too much yet, but its presence is noticeable in a satisfying way. Well-balanced BA funky biere de garde.
